ab|kystybyi.name: Kystybyi
ab|kystybyi.author: Spicing Your Life
steps: Combine the dough ingredients and knead until a soft dough forms.
Let rest for 30 minutes, then divide into small balls and flatten them into thin tortillas of [6"] diameter.
Mash the filling ingredients together.
Heat a nonstick pan and cook the dough on both sides.
Remove the tortillas; take a spoonful of the filling and spread it onto half of them. Fold the other half over and press down.
Heat the pan again with butter and fry the folded tortillas until crispy on both sides.

ab|ajika.name: Red Ajika
ab|ajika.author: Kat Craddock
steps: Blend everything together in a food processor until a thick salsa is made.

af|mantu.name: Mantu
af|mantu.author: Afghan Kitchen Recipes
steps: To make the filling, heat a pan over medium heat and add everything but the pepper to it, cooking for 15-20 minutes until the meat is approximately half cooked.
Add the black pepper and onions to the mixture and remove from heat, letting cool to room temperature.
To make the topping, first soak the lentils for 2–3 hours or overnight.
Heat oil in a frying pan and cook the onions and garlic until they're lightly browned.
Add the tomato, tomato paste, lentils, and [3/4 cup] water. Cook until soft for 30–45 minutes.
Take off heat and add salt and pepper. Let cool to room temperature.
For the dip, combine the ingredients mix to combine.
For the dough, gradually add water to the flour, mixing until a cohesive dough forms, then let it settle for 15-20 minutes until firm.
Break the dough apart and form small balls, then roll them into flat [1/16 inch] circles on a floured surface or using a pasta machine.
Place around [1tbsp] of the filling in each circle, then moisten the edges with water and fold in half to enclose them, pressing to seal.
Boil water and set up a steamer dish. Lightly oil it, then place the dumplings on it and steam them, covered, for 40 minutes.
Add a layer of the yoghurt mix to a plate, then place the dumplings on top. Cover with more yoghurt mix and the topping.
Garnish with pinch of cayenne pepper and dried mint.

al|fergese.name: Fergesë e Tiranës me Piperka
al|fergese.author: My Albanian Food
steps: Cook the onion in olive oil for about 3 minutes until it softens, then set aside.
Simmer the peppers, basil, and tomatoes on medium-high heat for 10 minutes until only a little liquid remains. Add the onions back in and set aside.
Melt the butter and add flour to make a roux. Add in the feta cheese, stirring quickly, until a thick roux forms, then add the yoghurt.
Mix the roux into the pepper mixture, season with the chili flakes, salt, and pepper.
Pour the mixture into clay dishes (or ramekins) and cook on [180C] for 30 minutes. Cool slightly, then serve.

al|flija.name: Flija
al|flija.author: My Albanian Food
steps: Mix together the flour batter ingredients, ensuring no lumps remain. The batter should be thick but pourable.
Mix together the filling ingredients, then let it rest for 10 minutes before stirring again.
Set your oven to the low broiler setting and grease a baking tray or pie pan.
Using a ladle, spread a thin layer of flour batter into the pan in a sort of star shape, leaving triangles of the pan unbattered.
Broil until golden brown, for 3-5 minutes.
Remove from the broiler and fill the entire pan with a thin layer of filling, covering both the battered and unbattered areas.
Add another thin layer of the batter in a star shape, this time covering the areas that were not covered previously.
Add back to the broiler for another 3-5 minutes.
Repeat this process until all the mixture has been used up, which should take around 2 hours. Every few layers, use the batter to fill up any gaps that have formed.
Serve with yoghurt or honey.

sv|nuegados.name: Nuégados de Yuca
sv|nuegados.author: Vera Abitbol

ingredience.ingredient: cassava, peeled, rinsed and ground very finely
panela, broken into pieces or ground

steps: Combine the panela sugar, water and spices into a saucepan.
Simmer over medium heat until the sugar dissolves.
Stir and cook over low heat for 10-15 minutes, until the mixture thickens enough to coat a spoon.
Mix all the ingredients to form a dough and shape the nuégados into small discs.
Heat a large pot with oil and fry the nuégados until they turn golden brown.
Serve the nuégados with the honey.

sv|atol.name: Atol de Elote
sv|atol.author: Sasha Martin
steps: Add all ingredients to a pot, with sugar to taste. Heat pot to a simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Blend it all up.
Strain and serve hot, topping with ground cinnamon.

sv|pupusa.name: Cheese Pupusas
sv|pupusa.author: peep

ingredience.ingredient: heavy whipping cream, or more to taste

steps: Salt some water in a pot and bring it to a boil.
Put cabbage in pot and cook uncovered for around 3 minutes until slightly softened.
Drain the cabbage and immediately place in an ice water bath to stop the cooking.
Combine all the curtido ingredients in a large bowl. Mix and refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight.
Mix water, masa harina, and [1/2 teaspoon] salt together, then knead until a smooth, moist dough forms. Add more water if the dough cracks. Let rest for 5-10 minutes.
Stir filling ingredients together.
Divide the dough into [8] balls. Press down into the center of each ball to form a hole, filling with the cheese mix.
Pinch the sides together to seal the dough ball, then flatten into round [1/4 inch]-thick discs with your hands.
Grease and preheat a pan over medium heat. Cook the pupusas in batches for 2-3 minutes per side, until browned.
Drain the curtido and serve with the pupusas.

gq|kongodo.name: Nkate Cake (Kongodo)
gq|kongodo.author: Sarah-Eden Dadoun
steps: Preheat the oven to [320F]. Spread peanuts on a baking sheet and roast them for 10 minutes.
Let the peanuts cool, then crush them with a rolling pin or lightly chop them in a food processor.
Stir together water, sugar, and some lemon juice in a pot.
Cook the mixture on medium heat untilt he sugar dissolves and it reaches a temperature of [320F].
Add the crushed peanuts to the syrup and stir constantly for 2-3 minutes over low heat.
Spread the mixture on a greased cutting board or parchment paper and roll to a thickness of [1/3 inch].
Quickly create a grid pattern with a knife across the top of the mixture while it's still hot.
Once it has cooled, break into pieces along the grid.

gq|porridge.name: Ginger Millet Porridge
steps: Whisk together the flour, sugar, ginger, and water until a smooth mixture forms.
Add the mixture to a small pot.
Place the pot on the stove and stir in the milk.
Heat the mixture until it simmers and cook until thickened, whisking constantly and adding more milk if needed.
Top with sugar and cinnamon and serve.

gq|ginja.name: Ginja Beer
gq|ginja.author: Sabrina Gérard

ingredience.ingredient: fresh ginger, peeled and finely grated

steps: Heat a saucepan over medium heat and add the ginja syrup ingredients.
Stir until the sugar is dissolved and the mixture begins to boil
Turn off the heat and steep the mixture for one hour.
Strain the solids from the mixture and let the syrup cool.
Add all of the ingredients to a large bottle.
Seal the bottle and shake until the yeast dissolves.
Store the bottle in at room temperature, out of direct sunlight, for 2 days.
During this time, open the bottle once every day to let out excess gas.
Refrigerate after 2 days to slow down the fermentation.

er|zigni.name: Zigni Spaghetti
er|zigni.author: Spencer
steps: Heat a pot with [2tbsp] oil over medium-high heat.
Add onion and sauté for 3-4 minutes until it turns transparent.
Add the garlic and sauté for another 2 minutes.
Add everything but the spaghetti, tempeh, and cheese to the pot. Reduce heat to a simmer and stir frequently for around 15 minutes until the sauce reaches the desired consistency.
Cook the spaghetti and sauté the tempeh according to their packaged instructions.
Stir the tempeh into the sauce and cook for another couple minutes.
Plate the pasta, then pour the sauce on top. Add parmesan.

er|tsebhi.name: Tsebhi Sega
er|tsebhi.author: Lisa
steps: Heat the oil in a large pot, then cook the onions until slightly browned.
Add the clarified butter and berbere spice and cook until fragrant. Simmer at low heat for about 8 minutes.
Add everything but the meat and cook for 5 more minutes.
Add the meat and simmer until done (around 30-40 minutes), adding water if needed.
Serve with flatbread.

ee|cottage.name: Kana-kodujuustukotletid

ingredience.ingredient: handful of sunflower, pumpkin, flax, and/or sesame seeds

steps: Mix everything but the bread crumbs together.
Let rest in refrigerator for 20 minutes.
Roll out the mixture into small balls and dip them into the breadcrumbs.
Fry the balls in hot oil on both sides.

ee|kohuke.name: Kohuke
ee|kohuke.author: Johannes Tamegger
steps: Mix everything but the chocolate together.
Pour mixture into a rectangular mold.
Freeze for 40 minutes.
While freezing the mixture, melt chocolate in a double boiler.
Remove mixture from mold, cut into rectangles.
Dip each rectangle in chocolate, then let harden in fridge for 20 minutes.

sz|mealie.name: Mealie Corn Bread
sz|mealie.author: Immaculate Bites
steps: Grease a cake pan or line it with parchment paper and preheat the oven to [350F].
Chop kernels off the corn if you're using a cob, then pulse briefly with a blender or food processor until it's chopped up a good bit.
In a separate bowl, whisk together all the dry ingredients except the basil.
Add all the non-butter liquid ingredients and whisk them, too.
Toss in the basil, butter, and corn chunks, then mix until combined.
Pour the batter into the cake pan and bake for 40-45 minutes or until golden brown.

sz|slaai.name: Slaai
sz|slaai.author: Mike Benayoun
steps: Combine ginger, salt, and lemon juice into a bowl.
Cut the avocado into [1/2 inch] chunks, and gently mix into the marinade.
Marinate for 20 minutes, then sprinkle with crushed peanuts and radishes.

et|niterkibbeh.name: Niter Kibbeh
et|niterkibbeh.author: Larry Jacobsen
steps: Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat.
Add everything else and simmer on the lowest setting heat for an hour.
Strain the liquid, discarding the solids, and store in the refrigerator.

et|kitcha.name: Kicha FitFit
et|kitcha.author: Shalom
steps: Mix water, flour, and salt.
Put a pan on the stove set to medium heat, grease with oil, then pour some batter into the pan. Cook both sides until golden, and repeat with the remaining batter.
Combine the Niter Kibbeh, Berbere, and salt in a pan and heat on low.
Tear the bread into pieces and add them to the melted butter and spice mixture. Stir to coat.
Top with yoghurt and serve.

et|wat.name: Doro Wat
et|wat.author: Kimberly Killebrew

ingredience.ingredient: Tej (Ethiopian honey wine), or white wine mixed with 1 teaspoon honey

steps: After hard-boiling eggs, pierce them all around about [1/4 inch] deep.
Place the chicken in a bowl and cover with lemon juice. Let marinate at room temperature for 30 minutes or more.
Heat the Niter Kibbeh and olive oil in a pot. Add onions and saute on low heat, covered, for 45 minutes. Stir occasionally.
Add ginger, garlic, and [1tbsp] butter. Continue sauteing, covered and stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes.
Add [2tbsp] of butter and Berbere. Continue sauteing, covered and stirring occasionally, for another 30 minutes.
Add everything else but the eggs and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to the lowest setting, then cover, simmer, and stir occasionally for 45 minutes.
Add eggs and simmer for 15 more minutes. Still covered. Still stirring occasionally.
Cut the eggs into halves or quarters and arrange on plates with the stew. Serve with injera.

et|injera.name: Injera
et|injera.author: Kimberly Killebrew

ingredience.ingredient: teff flour, optionally with some barley or wheat flour

steps: Combine flour and water, plus a tiny bit of yeast. Stir to combine.
Loosely cover and let sit at room temperature for 2-3 days.
Heat a pan over medium heat. Pour batter onto pan, and cook until bubbles form and pop.
Cover and turn off heat. LEt steam for a few minutes, then remove from pan and repeat with remaining batter.

fj|mutton.name: Corned Mutton Curry
fj|mutton.author: Sanjana Soni
steps: Peel and cut potatoes into smallish cubes.
Heat the oil in a pan and add the seeds. Heat until they brown slightly.
Add onions, crushed and minced garlic and ginger, and cook until brown.
Add everything but the potatoes and mutton and stir to combine, then toss in the potatoes.
Cook on medium heat until potatoes are done, then add corned mutton and cook for 5 more minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice.

fj|kava.name: Kava Drink
fj|kava.author: TheCoconetTV
steps: Put the kava in a cloth bag or cheesecloth and hold it over a container.
Pour the water, in small amounts, over the kava, and press it down so it mixes with the powder and soaks through the cloth.
Repeat until all water has gone through the cloth and the container has plenty of brownish water in it.

fj|cassava.name: Cassava Cake
fj|cassava.author: Kittyz Kitchen
steps: Mix sugar, coconut, and grated cassava. Add half of the condensed milk, stir to combine. Let rest for 10 minutes.
Stir one more time and spread into a cake tin. Bake at [180C] for 40 minutes.
Remove from oven, pour rest of condensed milk on top. Spread evenly, then bake for 7-10 more minutes.

fi|pasties.name: Karelian Pasties
fi|pasties.author: NcMysteryShopper
steps: For the Rice Filling: boil water, add rice and simmer until rice absorbs water.

Add milk and boil, then cook for a few minutes, stirring constantly. Lower heat to low, cover pan, and let simmer, stirring occasionally, for 30-40 minutes until it has thickened into a porridge-like texture.
Let cool, then add [1] egg or [1-2] egg yolks in and add salt to taste.
For the Potato Filling: Boil potatoes until tender, then save [50-100 ml] of the liquid when draining.
Mash potatoes and let cool. Add eggs and enough reserved liquid and cream to get a smooth not-too-runny texture.
Add butter and salt to taste, stir, cover, and set aside to cool.
For the Pasty Dough: Mix flour and salt, then add oil andw ater until a non-sticky dough forms.
Divide into [20] equal pieces and roll into small balls.
With a rolling pin, roll out balls into thin disks around [1mm] thick and [10-15cm] in diameter. Keep covered while rolling out the rest to stop them from drying out.
Spread filling onto the center of a dough ball. Raise edges toward the center and pinch to make an oval ridge, keeping the center open. Repeat with remaining dough balls.
Put pasties on parchment-lined baking sheet and bake at [255-300c] for 5-7 minutes or until they turn a darkish brown.
While baking, heat [150ml] whole milk in saucepan, add butter, and let melt. Once the pasties are cooked, dip them one at a time into the mixture and then place in a large bowl.
Cover bowl with parchment paper, and let soften for half an hour.
For Spread: Boil eggs for 10 minutes. Rinse with cold water and shell them. Mash eggs together with butter. Season to taste with salt, then spread on pasties.

fi|casserole.name: Sweetened Potato Casserole
fi|casserole.author: stormylee
steps: Clean potatoes and boil until cooked.
Drain water and let moisture evaporate. Once the potatoes are dry, peel and mash them.
Add flour to potatoes, mix, and let stand in a warm place (no hotter than [50c]) for 3-4 hours or overnight.
Add milk and butter to a pan over medium heat until milk is warm and butter is melted.
Add melted butter, warm milk, salt, and nutmeg into the potato mix and stir to combine. Optionally add treacle if mixture isn't sweet enough.
Pour into greased pans - no more than half full - and pour some treacle on top. Cook at [150c] for 2-3 hours.

fr|boeuf.name: Boeuf Bourguignon
fr|boeuf.author: Chef Kate
steps: For the Stew: Cut bacon into [1/4 in]x[1.5 in] long strips, removing the rinds and saving for later. Simmer for 10 minutes in [1.5 qt] water.
Drain and dry the bacon and set aside.
Preheat the oven to [450F].
Heat olive oil in an oven-resistant pot or casserole dish, then sauté bacon for 2-3m to lightly brown them.
Remove bacon from pot and set aside. Dry off the beef cubes and sauté them in the olive oil and bacon fat until browned on all sides.
Remove beef from pot and set aside with bacon. Sauté the carrot and onion in the fat until softened.
Drain the fat and return the meats to the pan. Toss with salt and pepper, and sprinkle with flour.
Put the pot, uncovered, in the oven for 4 minutes.
Remove pot from oven, stir and toss the ingredients, then return to the oven for another 4 minutes.
Lower the heat to [325F] and remove the pot from the oven.
Add wine and stock until the meat is barely covered.
Add garlic, tomato paste, herbs, and bacon rinds to the pot, then bring to a simmer on the stove.
Cover and put in oven - adjusting the heat if necessary - so the liquid simmers slowly for 3-4 hours until a fork easily pierces the meat.
For the Onions: Heat butter and oil in a skillet and add the onions.
Sauté over medium heat for 10 minutes, gently stirring the onions so they brown easily.
Pour in stock, add herbs and season to taste, and cover.
Simmer for 40-50m until onions are tender and most of the liquid has evaporated.
Remove herbs and set onions aside.
For the Mushrooms: Heat butter and oil in a skillet, then add the mushrooms.
Toss and stir the mushrooms in the pan for about 5 minutes.
Remove mushrooms from heat as soon as they are lightly browned, then set aside.
Combining: Remove pot from oven and empty its contents into a sieve set over another pot.
Clean the original pot and return the meat to it, tossing the carrots, onions, and herbs that are still in the sieve or strainer.
Toss the mushrooms and onions over the meat.
Skim the fat off the sauce, then cover and simmer over medium-low heat for 2-3 minutes, skimming off any additional fat that rises.
You should have around [2.5 cup] of sauce that can lightly coat the back of a spoon. If it is too thick, add stock. If it is too thin, boil it down.
Add salt and pepper as needed, then add meat and vegetables.
Simmer everything, covered, for another 2-3 minutes over medium heat.
Serve with noodles or potatoes and fresh parsley.

fr|onion.name: French Onion Soup
fr|onion.author: Binging with Babish
steps: Cut onions in half along their root. Trim root and tip, and stem. Thinly slice onions pole-to-pole.
Add broth to pot and heat, adding parsley, carrots, thyme, garlic, bay leaves, pepper, and cloves. Simmer for around an hour.
Add olive oil to a pot or dutch oven, heat for a few minutes, then add in onions.
Stir onions regularly, over medium heat, until soft and jammy.
Add flour to the onions, stir, and cook for 1-2 more minutes.
Deglaze onion pot with sherry. Scrape fond off bottom of pot.
Cook for a few minutes, then add the strained broth to the onions. Simmer for 5-10 minutes.
Slice baguette into pieces, drizzle with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Toast for 4-5 minutes.
Slice a clove of garlic in half and rub over the toast pieces.
Fill oven-safe crocks or ramekins with soup. Top with cheese, toast, and more cheese.
Broil for 3-5 minutes until cheese has melted. Top with chives.

fr|crossahwn.name: Croissants
fr|crossahwn.author: Bruno Albuoze

ingredience.ingredient: instant yeast or twice as much fresh yeast

steps: Make a [6 in]x[6 in] slab of with [250g] of the butter using parchment paper or plastic. Chill.

Mix all remaining ingredients (minus the eggs) on low speed until combined. Increase speed and mix until dough pulls away from the sides of the bowl; scraping the sides of any dough that sticks to them. Mix for around 8 minutes.
Put dough in an oiled bowl, cover with a damp towel or oiled plastic wrap and let rise in a warm area.
Once dough has tripled in size, pour onto a lightly floured surface and punch down.
Flatten dough, then fold in thirds over itself. Wrap and refrigerate overnight.
Let butter slab warm up at room temperature for 30 minutes; it should have roughly the same consistency as the dough.
Roll the dough to be approximately twice as long as the slab of butter. Add the slab of butter to one side, and fold the rest of the dough over.
Flatten and roll out into a [6in]x[27in] rectangle.
Sweep off any excess flour, then fold the left side of the dough two-thirds of the way over. Fold the right side to meet it. Flatten, then fold in half and flatten again.
Flatten to an [8in]x[24in] rectangle. Fold the left side a third of the way into the center, then fold the right side over it.
Flatten, wrap, and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Whisk together [2] eggs (or [1] egg plus [1] egg yolk) to make an egg wash.
Cut dough in half, then refrigerate one half.
Roll remaining half into [9in]x[18in] rectangle.
Cut dough into six large croissants.
Place croissants on greased parchment paper.
Roll croissants into shape, top with egg wash, and let proof for 2.5-3 hours until risen and spongy.
Preheat oven to [400F].
Bake for 10 minutes. Then lower heat to [375F] and bake for another 12-15 minutes.

ga|boeuf.name: Boeuf aux Mangues Sauvages
ga|boeuf.author: The Congo Cookbook

ingredience.ingredient: Palm Oil, or any other oil

steps: Bring a few cups of salted water to a boil. Cook meat for a few minutes, then drain and set aside.
Heat the oil in a pot and then add tomatoes, onions, and shrimp.
Cook for a few minutes, then add the meat. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for an hour.
Stir in ogbono, a little bit at a time, so no lumps form. If using whole ogbono, first toast in oil, then crush with mortar and pestle. Adjust seasoning.
Serve with boiled sweet potatoes.

ga|cuke.name: Cucumber Salad
ga|cuke.author: Heather
steps: Peel and seed the cucumber, then slice the tomatoes, onions, and cucumber very thinly.
Finely chop the parsley and mint. Combine with the vegetables in a bowl.
Mix olive oil, lemon juice, and seasonings, then pour over the veggies and toss to combine.

gm|dibi.name: Dibi
gm|dibi.author: Dada’s FoodCrave Kitchen
steps: Slice onions into thick ~[1/2 inch] cuts, and then push the layers apart to get thick onion rings.
Lightly oil a cast-iron grill pan and heat it to medium-high heat.
Add meat to pan and begin cooking. Add the liquid smoke and stir to combine.
Halfway through grilling, add salt to taste and stir.
Near the end of cooking, add all remaining seasonings except mustard and the onions.
Continue cooking and stirring until the onion is softer but still has a crunch to it.
After the onion has softened, add in the mustard and stir to combine.

gm|tapalapa.name: Tapalapa
gm|tapalapa.author: Mike Benayoun
steps: Mix the flours together in the bowl of a stand-in mixer. Add in salt, yeast, and water. Mix well and knead the dough for a few minutes until smooth and elastic.
Place the ball of dough in a greased bowl and cover with a clean cloth. Let it rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1 hour.

Cut the dough into 3 pieces and form baguette loaves. Place them on a baking sheet, optionally sprinkled with cornmeal, or lined with parchment paper. Let them rise for 30 minutes. Make one long shallow cut on top of each loaf with a knife.
Preheat oven to [450F], and bake tapalapa for 15 minutes until golden brown.

ge|khachapuri.name: Adjarian Khachapuri
ge|khachapuri.author: Georgian cooking with Nino
steps: To a bowl, add warm milk, warm water, yeast, salt, sugar, and oil. Mix to combine.
Add liquid to flour, stir and knead for several minutes into a dough. Let sit for 1.5-2 hours.
Punch down dough and knead a bit more. Split into [2] balls.
For each boat, flatten and roll into a rectangular shape. Add some cheese along the longer sides of the dough rectangle, then fold the edges of the dough over the cheese.
Bring the corners on the shorter sides together and then twist together a few times, forming the boat shape. Fill the center with cheese.
Cook the boats for 15 minutes in a pre-heated [250C] oven.
Remove from oven, stir a hole into the middle of each boat, and crack an egg into each hole, then return to the oven for another 2 minutes.
Drop a slice of butter onto the top of each boat and serve.

ge|badrijani.name: Badrijani Nigvzit
ge|badrijani.author: Jenny Holm

ingredience.ingredient: ground fennugreek, or twice as much utskho suneli/blue fennugreek
red pepper flakes or cayenne pepper
pomegranate seeds, cilantro, or thinly-sliced onions, as a topping

steps: Blend together the walnuts, garlic, spices, vinegar and water in a food processor until smooth. Store in refrigerator until needed.
Wash eggplants and cut their tops off. Slice lengthwise into [1/2 inch] thick slices.
Salt the eggplant slices and let stand for an hour, then press out the dark juices. Rinse and pat dry.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook eggplant slices until soft and brown on both sides, then remove from heat. Repeat until all slices are fried.
After the slices have cooled, spread a layer of filling on each slice and roll them up. Add desired topping and serve.

de|kartoffelklosse.name: Kartoffelklöße
de|kartoffelklosse.author: German Culture.com.ua
steps: Melt butter in a skillet, then sauté bread until browned. Remove from pan and set aside.
Mash potatoes and combine with flour, egg, and seasonings, then divide and roll into [24] balls, flouring your hands to prevent sticking.
Lower a few dumplings at a time into a pot of boiling water. Cook for an additional 3-5 minutes after they rise to the surface, then remove from the water with a slotted spoon.

de|pretzel.name: Bavarian Pretzels
de|pretzel.author: Sean Finch
de|pretzel.notes: It is recommended to use a mixture of baking soda and water instead of lye if you do not have adequate protection and equipment. You can find recipes for baked baking soda solutions online.
steps: Mix water, yeast, and syrup. Wait 7-10 minutes for the yeast to start foaming.
Add flour, beer, butter and salt. Mix to combine.
Knead dough for 10-20 minutes until an elastic dough forms.
Let dough rest at room temperature for 20-30 minutes, then place in an oiled bowl, covered in plastic wrap, to rise overnight in the fridge.

Divide into 6 balls, then roll them out into ~[30cm] ropes that are thicker in the middle. Once rolled out, fold into a "U" shape, fold one side over the other, fold over a second time, then move both ends over the bottom of the "U" and tuck the ends under the thickest part of the dough.
Let the dough rise for another 20-30 minutes, then refrigerate until the lye mixture is ready.
With gloves and goggles on, fill a glass bowl with water, then slowly pour in the lye. Carefully stir until combined and the mixture is not too cloudy.

Remove the pretzels from the fridge and, one at a time, dunk them in the lye mixture, letting them stay in the mixture for 10 seconds on each side. Remove the pretzels and place them on a glass baking tray or on parchment paper.
Sprinkle coarse salt on the pretzels, then carefully cut a slit across the thickest parts of the pretzels at their bottoms.
Bake at [425F] for 22-24 minutes or until they turn a deep golden brown color.
